Detailed Description

Class SerialDeviceWatcher followed by adding/removing the serial devices in the system.

This class is part of the library QSerialDevice and can be used in conjunction with the class AbstractSerial.

This class allows provides the following features:

  • Receive a list of names of all available serial devices in the system.
  • Report on deleting/adding the serial device.
Note:
In the current version - working class tested (tested by the author.) only in operating systems:
  • MS Windows XP Pro SP3
  • ArchLinux x86_64

The principle of class in different operating systems have significant differences:

  • In MS Windows XP - information about the presence of serial devices, as well as events by adding/removing serial device, is extracted by reading the registry for the relevant ways, and Control changes some keys.
  • In Linux - for information UDEV used in conjunction with the analysis of the contents of the directory "/dev/".

Getting Started with the class should begin with the creation of an object instance SerialDeviceWatcher.
Example: 

        ...
        SerialDeviceWatcher *sdw = new SerialDeviceWatcher(this);
        connect(sdw, SIGNAL(hasChanged(const QStringList &)), this, SLOT(showChange(const QStringList &)));
        ...

By default, a new instance of the class is created with a disabled control/tracking of the presence/absence of serial devices.

Code: 

        ...
        connect(sdw, SIGNAL(hasChanged(const QStringList &)), this, SLOT(showChange(const QStringList &)));
        ...

can be used if you wish to receive and process signals/notification about adding/removing the serial devices in system (see below description of the signal hasChanged() ).

Note:
Make connect necessary to the call method: setEnabled(true).

To activate/deactivate control/monitoring of serial devices use the method:

  • void SerialDeviceWatcher::setEnabled(bool enable).

For the get state of class (enabled or disabled) using the method:

  • bool SerialDeviceWatcher::isEnabled() const.

For a list of names of all available serial devices in the system using the method:

  • QStringList SerialDeviceWatcher::devicesAvailable() const.

Class SerialDeviceWatcher implements the following signals:

  • void SerialDeviceWatcher::hasChanged(const QStringList &list) - emitted Each time you add/remove At least one serial device.
    Note:
    When you first call the method setEnabled(true) - the signal will automatically transfer to the variable list list of names of all available in the current time serial devices. In subsequent calls to the method setEnabled() - signal is automatically emitted only: when the state of class is Enabled And when adding/removing devices.



Warning:
By default, the class is configured in such a way as to write to the console debug messages. To disable these messages in the console - need to comment out in the *. cpp files, a line like: 
        ...
        # define NATIVESERIALENGINE_DEBUG
        ...
and re-rebuild the library.
Version:
0.2.0

Member Function Documentation

QStringList SerialDeviceWatcher::devicesAvailable (  )  const

Returns a list of all serial devices that are present in the system at the time of the method call.

Returns:
  • list of names for serial devices
  • 0 in case of error or the absence of serial devices

Definition at line 234 of file serialdevicewatcher.cpp.

SerialDeviceWatcher::hasChanged ( const QStringList &  list  )  [signal]

This signal is emitted each time only when adding/removing the serial device from the system. The only exception is the case when the first method is called setEnabled(true) - then the signal is automatically forced emitted!

Parameters:
[out] list - updated after the add/remove a list of names for serial devices.
bool SerialDeviceWatcher::isEnabled (  )  const

Returns the current status/state/mode class SerialDeviceWatcher.

Returns:
  • true - monitor enabled
  • false - monitoring disabled
Note:
enable/disable monitoring is performed by: setEnabled(bool enable).

Definition at line 268 of file serialdevicewatcher.cpp.

void SerialDeviceWatcher::setEnabled ( bool  enable  ) 

Enables or disables the mode of monitoring and tracking of adding or removing successive devices from the system.

Parameters:
[in] enable - flag:

  • If its value is true - that included the regime of monitoring and tracking
  • If its value is false - then switch off the monitoring/tracking
